pr_title: Don't throw exceptions for invalid baggage like other APIs

timeline.message: Don't throw exceptions for invalid baggage like other APIs

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should do a fine-level logging here (can be discussed in/as a follow-up).
timeline.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText:
We currently don't log for parameter checks in most places I believe. Maybe we should, but I think we should do it consistently separate from removing the exceptions.
@bogdandrutu To throw exceptions, I believe we'd need a spec change https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/error-handling.md#basic-error-handling-principles
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.author: bogdandrutu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,9 @@
    * @return an {@code EntryMetadata}.
    */
   public static EntryMetadata create(String metadata) {

replies.bodyText: We don't use Nullable on APIs which shouldn't be passed null but we have defensive behavior anyways. IIUC this is the answer to all your comments?
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: This is wrong, either not allow and check for null or throw exception.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: Either throw exception or allow Nullable
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
